qas.question: What type of genes are necessary for performing basic cell functions?
At what relative level are housekeeping genes expressed at?
When investigating gene expression, what type of genes are used as a control for experiments?
How are some essential genes regulated?
When are some essential genes expressed?

answers.text: at certain times during the organism's life cycle

context: <a0_0>Housekeeping genes<a0_0/> are critical for carrying out basic cell functions and so are expressed at a relatively <a1_0>constant<a1_0/> level (constitutively). Since their expression is constant, <a2_0>housekeeping genes<a2_0/> are used as experimental controls when analysing gene expression. Not all essential genes are housekeeping genes since some essential genes are <a3_0>developmentally<a3_0/> regulated or expressed <a4_0>at certain times during the organism's life cycle<a4_0/>.
